description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows cryptographic information disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2024-43546):

1. Download the appropriate KB articles for your system version from the links provided below.
2. Follow the installation steps outlined in the update documentation to apply the patches.
3. Restart your system to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially exploit observable discrepancies in the cryptographic implementation, which could lead to information disclosure.
- Ensure your system matches one of the specified build numbers before proceeding with the updates.

**Update Packages**:
- For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
- For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
- For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
- For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
- For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
- For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)

**Preconditions**:
- Verify that your system version corresponds to the specified builds.
- Backup critical data before applying updates.
